description: Connect to the Breezometer Air Quality API to get global, local, real-time data on air quality. Test an API call and export the code snippet into your app.

blocks.name: getAirQuality
blocks.description: You can get air quality data by Latitude and Longitude (Geocoding)

args.name: coordinates
args.info: Geographic coordinate. Latitude and longitude. Example: 51.491751537714705,-0.02414792776107788

args.name: fields
args.info: Set of fields separated by commas

args.name: lang
args.info: Response language. Support English(“en”) and Hebrew(“he”).

blocks.name: getSpecificDateAirQuality
blocks.description: You can get air quality data by Latitude and Longitude (Geocoding)

args.name: coordinates
args.info: Geographic coordinate. Latitude and longitude. Example: 51.491751537714705,-0.02414792776107788

args.name: datetime
args.info: The specific time you wish to get air quality data for. Date and time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SS

args.name: lang
args.info: Response language. Support English(“en”) and Hebrew(“he”).

blocks.name: getAirQualityHistoryForDateRange
blocks.description: You can get history air quality data for a range of dates in a specific location (Latitude and Longitude) with a start and end timestamps that will provide an array of results.

args.name: coordinates
args.info: Geographic coordinate. Latitude and longitude. Example: 51.491751537714705,-0.02414792776107788

args.name: start_datetime
args.info: The specific start time you wish to get air quality data for. Date and time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SS

args.name: end_datetime
args.info: The specific end time you wish to get air quality data for. Date and time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SS

args.name: interval
args.info: A time interval represents a period of time (hours) between two BAQI objects. You can choose an interval value (Integer) between 1-24 hours.

args.name: lang
args.info: Response language. Support English(“en”) and Hebrew(“he”).

blocks.name: getAirQualityForecast
blocks.description: You can get air quality data forecasts for a specific location for the next 24 hours

args.name: coordinates
args.info: Geographic coordinate. Latitude and longitude. Example: 51.491751537714705,-0.02414792776107788

args.name: hours
args.info: Hours represents the period of time for the Forecast data you’ll receive.You can choose any value (integer) up to 96 hours. The default period: 24 hours

args.name: lang
args.info: Response language. Support English(“en”) and Hebrew(“he”).
